adjective.description: Of the nature of, or characteristic of, a Pythian priestess; oracular; rapturous, frenetic.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Philemon Holland (1552–1637), translator. From classical Latin Pȳthicus and its etymon ancient Greek Πυθικός Pythian, Delphic from Πυθώ or Πύθων + -ικός. Compare Middle French, French pythique.
